subject: Track and Field
lead_paragraph: False starters in sprints face immediate exclusion from the race under a new proposal by the world governing body of track and field. Currently, one false start is allowed per race; another false start means the automatic exclusion of the guilty sprinter regardless of who caused the first false start. The new rule would mean an immediate expulsion for any offender.
